Question: Should patients with RA on MTX + boDMARD or MTX + tsDMARD who are at target withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) MTX or withdraw (taper off or abruptly stop) the boDMARD or the tsDMARD?

Explanations.a: Concern with risk of bias. Missing data was not appropriately handled in the trial.
Explanations.b: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Very small sample size.
Explanations.c: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting benefit. Very small sample size.
Explanations.d: Downgraded by one level due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size.
Explanations.e: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size, and low number of events.
Explanations.f: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting benefit. Very small sample size, and low number of events.
Explanations.g: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Very small sample size, and very low number of events.

Explanations.a: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious inconsistency. I2=97%.
Explanations.b: Withdraw boDMARD or tsDMARD include withdraw boDMARDs (TNFis: adalimumab and etanercept)
Explanations.c: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious inconsistency. I2=92%.
Explanations.d: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. I2=80%.
Explanations.e: Pooled results reported as HR and RR in the 2 respective studies
Explanations.f: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment and lack of blinding.
Explanations.g: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. Unexplained heterogeneity I2=65%.
Explanations.h: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm.
Explanations.i: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. I2=70%.
Explanations.j: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect.
Explanations.k: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Incomplete outcome data (Overall loss to follow-up rate is 48)
Explanations.l: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. I2=82%.

References.1: Pablos JL. Efficacy of tocilizumab monotherapy after response to combined tocilizumab and methotrexate in patients with rheumatoid arthritis: the randomised JUST-ACT study. Clinical & Experimental Rheumatology. 2019;37:437-44.
References.2: Smolen JS. Adjustment of therapy in rheumatoid arthritis on the basis of achievement of stable low disease activity with adalimumab plus methotrexate or methotrexate alone: the randomised controlled OPTIMA trial.[Erratum appears in Lancet. 2014 Jan 25;383(9914):308]. Lancet. 2014;383(9914):321.
References.3: Smolen JS. Maintenance, reduction, or withdrawal of etanercept after treatment with etanercept and methotrexate in patients with moderate rheumatoid arthritis (PRESERVE): A randomised controlled trial. The Lancet. 2013;381(9870):918.
References.4: van Vollenhoven RF. Full dose, reduced dose or discontinuation of etanercept in rheumatoid arthritis. Ann Rheum Dis BMJ. 2016;75:52-8.
References.5: Chatzidionysiou K. A multicentre, randomised, controlled,open-label pilot study on the feasibilityof discontinuation of adalimumab inestablished patients with rheumatoidarthritis in stable clinical remission. 2016;2.
